node.title: 2 teachers killed at high school in Sweden, student arrested
node.description: The suspect wasn't previously known to the police and had no criminal record and police didn't disclose how the teachers were killed.

node.title: Crews rescue man stuck in pizza-sized storm drain field for two days
node.description: A passerby in an open field in Antioch, California happened to hear his cries for help, authorities say.

node.title: California woman accused of killing husband in 2015 captured in Mexico
node.description: Leticia Smith, 40, is being held on $2 million bail, San Bernardino County sheriff's officials said.

node.title: Divers say they likely found body of man missing since 2003
node.description: James Amabile disappeared after calling a babysitter to say he was running late to pick up his two daughters, his family said.

node.title: Watch Live: Ketanji Brown Jackson takes questions on day 2 of hearings
node.description: President Biden's Supreme Court pick is taking her first questions from senators on the second day of her confirmation hearings.

node.title: 'Don't worry' about Mt Ruapehu volcanic activity, mayor says
node.description: Locals living near Mt Ruapehu appear unfazed by the signs of elevated volcanic unrest, despite the strong tremors and the lake heating up.

node.title: Putin foe Navalny convicted of new fraud charges
node.description: Prosecutors want 13 years added to the two-and-a-half year term Vladimir Putin's most vocal critic is already serving.

node.title: Russian Embassy in NZ posts footage appearing to show alleged arson attempt
node.description: The Russian Embassy in New Zealand has published a video appearing to show an alleged arson attempt on its Karori building in Wellington.

node.title: Enchanter fishing charter tragedy: Fifth body found in water off North Cape
node.description: A fifth body has been found during the search and rescue operation off North Cape.

node.title: 'Potential extreme event': Heavy rain warning for Bay of Plenty, Hawke's Bay, Gisborne
node.description: MetService says the rain has the potential to be an "extreme event" and people are urged to keep up to date with advice in case the warnings are escalated.

node.title: Release 'should have happened six years ago', former hostage says
node.description: The British-Iranian woman was speaking publicly for the first time since her release from Iran last week.

node.title: Doctors break rules for prescribing safe-sex drug as Pharmac considers change
node.description: Doctors flagrantly broke rules for prescribing a safe-sex drug during 2021 Covid-19 lockdowns and say the requirements are "out of date" and require patients to detail their sexual history.

node.title: Man arrested after serious assault at Upper Hutt petrol station
node.description: A man remains in hospital with life-threatening injuries from the serious assault last Saturday.

node.title: Notorious Auckland intersection: 'Just waiting for someone to get killed'
node.description: Papakura residents say action needs to be taken before someone is killed at a notorious intersection which has been the scene of a number of serious crashes.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 20,907 new community cases, 15 deaths and 1016 people in hospital
node.description: Director-General of Health Ashley Bloomfield says there are also 25 people in ICU or HDU.

node.title: Man shot by Invercargill police appears in court
node.description: A man who was shot by police in Invercargill is facing a number of charges including assault with intent to rob.

node.title: No survivors found in China Eastern plane crash, state media says
node.description: State media reported all Boeing 737-800s in China Eastern's fleet were ordered grounded, an unusual move when there is no evidence the plane model is flawed.

node.title: Ukraine: Eight killed as Kyiv shopping centre wrecked by shelling
node.description: At least eight people were killed when shelling hit a Kyiv shopping centre, wrecking nearby buildings and leaving smoking piles of rubble.

node.title: Legislation to force company owners to be publicly identified
node.description: The government will force the disclosure of the real owners of companies and limited partnerships as it tightens up on money laundering, tax evasion and terrorism financing.

node.title: IPCA clear police of wrongdoing in excessive force complaint
node.description: Police have been cleared of using excessive force during a 2019 arrest in Masterton.

node.title: 'I could feel the current on my shins': Builder ignores danger to help unconscious woman
node.description: An Auckland man waded through flood waters with a live electric current to rescue a woman who had suffered an electric shock. Audio

node.title: Revoking the Licence to Kill: What New Zealand's police shootings tell us
node.description: Opinion - Policing operations must be planned with a focus on ensuring life is preserved rather than taken, including from accidents, AUT law professor Kris Gledhill writes.

node.title: Auckland Zoo welcomes Bornean orangutan baby
node.description: Auckland Zoo has announced the birth of a baby Bornean orang-utan to second-time parents Melur and Charlie. Video

node.title: "It's coming": President Biden warns of "evolving" Russian cyber threat to U.S.
node.description: While there's no evidence of a specific cyber attack threat, Anne Neuberger told reporters Monday afternoon that U.S. officials have observed "preparatory work" linked to nation-state actors.

node.title: China Eastern plane carrying 132 people crashes in Guangxi
node.description: A China Eastern Airlines plane carrying 132 people on board has crashed in Guangxi province, China's Civil Aviation Administration of China says.

node.title: Ukraine refuses to surrender Mariupol as Russia warns of humanitarian 'catastrophe'
node.description: Ukraine has rejected Russian calls to surrender the port city of Mariupol, where residents are besieged with little food, water and power and fierce fighting shows little sign of easing.

node.title: At least 4 injured as severe storms sweep across Texas
node.description: Images​ showed damage to parts of Jacksboro High School, especially its gym, and parts of Jacksboro Elementary School.

node.title: University admits disciplinary process flawed in sexual assault case
node.description: Auckland University says it made mistakes in responding to a student's allegations of sexual assault.

node.title: Senate candidate Eric Greitens accused of domestic violence by ex-wife
node.description: The former Missouri governor has been part of a child custody battle with his ex-wife Sheena Greitens since April 2020.

node.title: Ukraine war: Green Party says $5m NZ funding could be diverted to 'saving lives'
node.description: The Green Party says New Zealand has put its relationship with the NATO security alliance ahead of saving lives in Ukraine.
